email_sequence.subject: Quick question about Kel-Toy, Inc.'s trade show process
email_sequence.body:
Hi Kelvin,

Noticed Kel-Toy, Inc. doesn't have mobile catalog access. When we see this, it usually means:

- Trade show orders written on paper, entered later
- Reps can't quote without calling the office
- Show leads lost to slow follow-up

Sound familiar? Or have you found workarounds?

email_sequence.subject: How Pebl Furniture eliminated your exact problem
email_sequence.body:
Hey Kelvin,

Pebl Furniture had Kel-Toy, Inc.'s exact problem:

"Manual catalog navigation killing productivity"

Their transformation:
• Order time: 4 hours → 15 minutes
• Error rate: 30% → <1%
• Eliminated 3 hours daily per rep waste
• 47-day payback period

Proven across $2.3M customer portfolio.

Want their implementation playbook?

Best,
[Your Name]

email_sequence.subject: 3 companies solved Kel-Toy, Inc.'s exact challenges
email_sequence.body:
Hey Kelvin,

3 companies solved Kel-Toy, Inc.'s challenges:

• Butler Specialty: 300% rep productivity increase
• Godinger Silver: "Best thing in 25 years"
• Wildwood Lamps: 33% fewer support calls

All report 25-40% productivity increases within 90 days.

12-minute video showing their results?

Best,
[Your Name]

email_sequence.subject: $750,000 impact for Kel-Toy, Inc.
email_sequence.body:
Hey Kelvin,

Kel-Toy, Inc.'s current inefficiencies:

• Productivity loss: $300,000/year
• Error costs: $262,500/year  
• Trade show waste: $187,500/year
• Total impact: $750,000/year

Investment: $20K/year
Payback: 47 days (validated across 15 customers)
5-Year ROI: 187x

Want your custom ROI model? Takes 15 minutes.

Best,
[Your Name]

email_sequence.subject: 3 competitors just passed Kel-Toy, Inc.
email_sequence.body:
Hey Kelvin,

While Kel-Toy, Inc. uses manual processes, 3 direct competitors digitized in 2024:

• Universal Furniture: 25% sales increase
• Theodore Alexander: 40% faster quotes  
• Butler Specialty: 300% rep productivity

Your competitors are 40% faster. Quote time: Them (minutes) vs You (hours).

Should we discuss closing this gap before High Point Market?

Best,
[Your Name]

email_sequence.subject: Ultraleather vs digital-native competitors
email_sequence.body:
Hi Ichiro,

I see Ultraleather still relies on PDF catalogs. Companies with manual distribution typically experience:

- Price updates taking 3-5 days to reach reps
- Conflicting quotes from outdated sheets
- Reps working from wrong info constantly

Is this creating headaches for your team?

email_sequence.subject: How Globalux Lighting eliminated your exact problem
email_sequence.body:
Hey Ichiro,

Globalux Lighting had Ultraleather's exact problem:

"Mobile failures devastate trade show performance"

Their transformation:
• Order time: 4 hours → 15 minutes
• Error rate: 30% → <1%
• Real-time mobile ordering at trade shows
• 47-day payback period

Proven across $2.3M customer portfolio.

Want their implementation playbook?

Best,
[Your Name]

email_sequence.claude_prompt:
Write a direct, punchy B2B sales email about competitive threats.

Context:
- Company: Ultraleather
- Contact: Ichiro
- Evidence: No mobile site for High Point Market?
- Competitors: Universal Furniture, Theodore Alexander, Butler Specialty

Requirements:
- Start with "Hey Ichiro,"
- Lead with competitive reality: "While Ultraleather uses manual processes, 3 competitors digitized in 2024"
- List specific competitor wins: Universal (25% sales increase), Theodore Alexander (40% faster quotes), Butler (300% rep productivity)
- Include urgency: "Your competitors are 40% faster. Quote time: Them (minutes) vs You (hours)"
- End with: "Should we discuss closing this gap before High Point Market?"
- Keep under 80 words
- No corporate speak, direct and urgent tone

Generate ONLY the email body, no subject line.
